name: GIQ
desc:
Welcome to the GIQ Trello Board, the central hub for our collaborative efforts in developing the Global IQ platform. This board is designed to provide a comprehensive overview of our project, facilitate seamless communication, and track our progress across various epics and features.

GIQ aims to deliver an innovative, sector-specific data collation and risk assessment platform that caters to the dynamic needs of the trade credit profession. Our focus is on creating a user-centric, data-driven experience that empowers our clients with actionable insights and streamlined operations.

The board is organised into several ‘Epics’, each representing a core component of the GIQ platform. Within each epic, you'll find lists that break down the project into more manageable user stories.

Everyone is encouraged to actively participate by providing comments, and collaborating on user story definition/refinement, problem-solving and prioritisation. Please ensure that all communication is clear, concise, and constructive, with a focus on pushing the project forward.

card.desc:
**As a user (who wants to view payment data for a debtor), I want to see payment information provided from debtor suppliers, insurance companies, collection agencies, credit rating agencies and payment check. This way, I can understand how the debtor is performing against other suppliers and on a global perspective.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Experian Payment Performance (Data sample attached containing all fields - see DBT report tab)
- D&B Payment Data & Delinquency Score
- Payment Check Data
- Client/Supplier Data (see Client/Supplier data card for data fields)
- Collections & Legal Data (see Collections & Legal data card for data fields)
- Insurance/Underwriter Data (see Insurance/Underwriter data card for data fields)

- Data fed into the search results is live

card.desc:
**As a user receiving monitoring alerts, I want to be able to see such alerts in a debtor report so that I can view all information in one location.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Debtor report created and inclusive of the latest monitoring alerts
- Monitoring alerts visible within an exported PDF
- Latest alerts visible with option to see historically
card.name: Debtor Report

old.desc:
**As a user looking wanting to keep up to date with debtors, I want to learn whenever new information is available, so that I can make any necessary credit risk changes to trade.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Monitoring includes any AI feeds relative to news updates or companies for which a supplier has written a comment
- Alerts and notifications sent via email to users monitoring a debtor
- Email alerts should provide a snapshot of the ‘update’ and a link to view the main changes
- Any main changes should be accessible via a link, and result in payment for extra information (e.g. updated financials)

card.desc:
**As a user who analyses credit risk, I want to be able to see a scorecard to understand the key performance indicators of a debtor, so that I can interpret an overall score and identify the main areas of concern when it comes to default risk.**

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A ‘scorecard’ established based on an algorithm, thresholds and weighted averages from the data found within a debtor report and the relevant background data
- The score is displayed within the debtor’s report alongside the ‘propensity to pay’ score
- The Scorecard should be multi-sector and not tailored per sector/industry
  (reason: a debtor might by multi-sector and be involved in apparel retail and manufacturing)
- The algorithm's scoring criteria are transparent and understandable.
- Scorecard criteria to be determined at a later date subject to what data we can obtain.
card.name: Scorecard

card.desc:
**As a user who analyses credit risk, I want to be able to see an overall score established on a scoring algorithm and scorecard so that I can see determine the likelihood of payment default when trading with the customer.**

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A ‘Propensity To Pay score’ established based on an algorithm, thresholds and weighted averages from the data found within a debtor report and the relevant background data.
- The algorithm's scoring criteria are transparent and understandable.
- The score is displayed within the debtor’s report.
- A recommendation is provided with such a score

card.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the latest news alerts of a debtor, so that I can make executive decisions about action to be taken.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include an area for ‘a latest news’
- AI intelligence utilised to target specific cases (e.g. for the words ‘john + lewis + sale’, I want to know if John Lewis is for sale, but I am less interested if John Lewis is having a sale)
- Alerts should be sent via email to notify a user of debtors they are trading with if there have been any developments.

card.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the performance of the debtor with collections agencies, so that I can see the amount with collections, the status of any legal involvement, and the general responsiveness/performance.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from Baker Ing
- Information included should consider:
  - Amount with collections
  - Payment recevied
  - Status (e.g. collections, legal letter sent, etc.)
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live and may be displayed in a list or graphic.
card.name: Collections Data

card.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the amount of write-offs and write-ins for a debtor, so that I can see how much is written off/in throughout an annual period to compare the debtors performance for my company to others.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from suppliers
- Information included should consider the write-offs and write-ins
- Visual aid such as a graph should be included
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live

board.desc:
Welcome to the GIQ Trello Board, the central hub for our collaborative efforts in developing the Global IQ platform. This board is designed to provide a comprehensive overview of our project, facilitate seamless communication, and track our progress across various epics and features.

GIQ aims to deliver an innovative, sector-specific data collation and risk assessment platform that caters to the dynamic needs of the trade credit profession. Our focus is on creating a user-centric, data-driven experience that empowers our clients with actionable insights and streamlined operations.

The board is organised into several ‘Epics’, each representing a core component of the GIQ platform. Within each epic, you'll find lists that break down the project into more manageable user stories.

Everyone is encouraged to actively participate by providing comments, and collaborating on user story definition/refinement, problem-solving and prioritisation. Please ensure that all communication is clear, concise, and constructive, with a focus on pushing the project forward.
board.name: GIQ

cards.desc:
**As a potential user (who wants to access services), I want to register for an account so that I can access the services provided by Global IQ.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Companies already trading with Global IQ will have administrative users configured, who should be able to create an account on behalf of a standard user
- New Users should be able to create an account through a ‘sign up’ button which should redirect the user to a billing/payments page for set up.
cards.name: User Account Registration

cards.desc:
**As a new user (who wants guidance), I want to receive a guided onboarding experience so that I understand how to use the platform effectively.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users are presented with a tutorial after account creation.
- The onboarding process covers key features and functionalities.
- Users can skip or revisit the onboarding tutorial.
cards.name: Guided Onboarding Experience

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants quick access), I want to log in to my account using my email and password so that I can access my personalised settings and data.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can log in through a secure login page.
- The system validates the email and password before granting access.
- Users are redirected to their dashboard upon successful login.
cards.name: Account Login Functionality

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants convenience), I want the option to stay logged in on my device so that I can access the platform quickly during future visits.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users have the option to remain logged in when entering their credentials.
- The system retains the user's session according to the selected preference.
- Users can log out from all devices remotely for security.
cards.name: Stay Logged In Option

cards.desc:
**As a user (who has changing circumstances), I want to be able to view and edit my profile information so that I can keep my personal details up to date.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can access their profile from the dashboard.
- Users can edit personal details and save changes.
- Changes are updated immediately and reflected across the platform.
cards.name: View and Edit Profile

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to maintain security), I want to change my password within the platform so that I can ensure my account remains secure.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can initiate a password change from their profile settings.
- Users must enter their current password before creating a new one.
- The system enforces strong password creation rules.
cards.name: Password Change Functionality

cards.desc:
**As a user (who has forgotten my password), I want to be able to reset it securely so that I can regain access to my account.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can request a password reset from the login page.
- Users receive a password reset link via email.
- Users can create a new password after verifying their identity.
- Administrative users should also be able to reset passwords for standard users via a ‘reset user password’ button within the ‘user management’ page
cards.name: Password Reset Function

cards.desc:
**As a user (who values security), I want to receive notifications if there are any changes to my account credentials so that I can be alerted to potential security issues.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users receive an email notification when their account details change.
- Notifications contain details of what was changed and when.
- Users have the option to contact support directly from the notification email.
cards.name: Account Change Notifications

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who manages user roles), I want to assign roles to users so that they have permissions appropriate to their responsibilities.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Admins can view all user roles within the platform.
- Admins can assign or reassign roles to users through the admin panel.
- The system updates user access based on the assigned role.
cards.name: User Role Assignment

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who wants to ensure proper access), I want to set access levels for specific features so that users can only access data and functions relevant to their role.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Access levels are clearly defined for each feature within the platform.
- Admins can configure access levels from a central control panel.
- The system restricts user access in real-time based on the configured settings.
cards.name: User Role Management

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who wants to manage user permissions), I want to create and manage roles with specific access rights so that I can ensure users have appropriate access to the platform's functions.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Admins can define new roles with custom access rights.
- Admins can modify existing roles and update their access rights as needed.
- Changes to roles and permissions are logged for audit purposes.
cards.name: Access Level Controls

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who needs to protect sensitive data), I want to restrict access to sensitive data based on user roles so that I can comply with data protection regulations and secure user information.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- The system prevents access to sensitive data for unauthorized roles.
- Admins receive alerts if unauthorized access attempts occur.
- Users receive information on the data they can access according to their roles.
cards.name: Sensitive Data Access Restriction

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who oversees platform usage), I want to view a log of user activities so that I can monitor usage and ensure compliance with platform policies.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Admins can access detailed logs of user activities within the platform.
- The system logs entries include timestamps, user IDs, and the nature of the activity.
- Logs can be exported for offline analysis and reporting.
cards.name: User Activity Log Monitoring

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who needs to secure the platform), I want to be alerted to any unusual activity so that I can prevent unauthorized access and potential security breaches.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- The system automatically detects and flags unusual activities.
- Admins receive real-time alerts about potential security incidents.
- The system provides actionable steps for admins to follow in case of an alert.
cards.name: Unusual Activity Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a user (who speaks multiple languages), I want to select my preferred language for the platform interface so that I can have a better user experience in my native language.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can select from a list of supported languages.
- The platform remembers the user's language preference for future sessions.
- Language settings apply to all interface elements and user communications.

(The go-to market will be UK and Ireland initially, so expansion into other markets and languages should come at a later stage of development)
cards.name: Multi-language Interface Option

cards.desc:
**As a user (who values security), I want to be able to log out from all devices remotely so that I can maintain control over my account access.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can initiate a remote logout from their account settings.
- The system logs out the user from all sessions across all devices.
- Users are notified when a remote logout has been successfully completed.
cards.name: Remote User Logout

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who manages access), I want to force log out users from the system when necessary so that I can quickly revoke access during security incidents or policy violations.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Admins can terminate any active user sessions from the admin panel.
- The system provides confirmation to the admin once the action is taken.
- Affected users receive a notification explaining why they were logged out.
cards.name: Admin-Initiated Force Logout

cards.desc:
**As a user with administrative rights (who wants to collaborate), I want to grant permissions to other users for specific data sets so that we can facilitate teamwork and data sharing where appropriate.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Admin users can set granular data access permissions for other users.
- The system allows for selective sharing of data sets based on permissions.
- Users can view which data sets they have been granted access to.
cards.name: User Permissions for Data Access

cards.desc:
**As a user (who needs clarity on access), I want to have clearly defined permissions so that I know what actions I can perform on the platform.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users have access to documentation or a dashboard that explains their permissions.
- The system shows or hides functionality based on user permissions.
- Users can request additional permissions through a formal process.
cards.name: Clear Definition of User Permissions

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who wants to automate data import), I want to implement API endpoints for various data sources so that real-time data accuracy is ensured.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- API endpoints are developed and functional.
- Data from various sources can be imported automatically.
- The system ensures the accuracy and integrity of imported data.
cards.name: API Integration for Data Import

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who wants secure authentication options), I want to set up multi-factor authentication for users so that I can add an additional layer of security to the account login process.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Multi-factor authentication is available for all users.
- Users can choose from several multi-factor options, like SMS, email, or an authenticator app.
- The system provides fallback options for users who have issues with their primary multi-factor method.
cards.name: Multi-factor Authentication Setup

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who needs to store imported data securely), I want to manage the storage of imported data so that it's stored securely and efficiently.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- A secure data storage system is implemented.
- The system is capable of storing large volumes of data.
- Data retrieval and backup processes are efficient and reliable.
cards.name: Data Storage Management

cards.desc:
**As an admin (who values modern security standards), I want to integrate biometric authentication options so that users can log in using state-of-the-art security methods.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Biometric authentication methods like fingerprint or facial recognition are available.
- The system allows users to set up and test their biometric data during setup.
- Users can still access their accounts through alternative methods if the biometric authentication fails.
cards.name: Biometric Authentication Integration

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who needs to process data), I want to manage server-side data processing so that data is correctly formatted and useful for the platform.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Data processing rules and algorithms are established.
- The system can handle data transformation and aggregation.
- Data processing is efficient and error-free.
cards.name: Server-Side Data Processing Workflow

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who needs to protect data), I want to ensure the security of data on the server so that user information is protected against unauthorised access.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Data security measures such as encryption and access controls are in place.
- Regular security audits are conducted.
- The system complies with relevant data protection regulations.
- Subject to debtors involvement (limited vs sole-trader) GDPR involvement would be required.
cards.name: Data Security Policy Enforcement

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to upload company data), I want a feature to upload my data to the platform so that I can analyse and store my information securely.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can upload data files in various formats.
- The system validates and processes uploaded data accurately.
- Users receive feedback on the success or failure of their company uploads.
- CSV file specific
cards.name: User-Driven Data Upload Feature

cards.desc:
**As a user (who needs offline access to data), I want to download data from the platform so that I can use it for my offline analysis and reporting.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Users can select and download data in PDF format.
- The download process is user-friendly and efficient.
- The integrity of the data is maintained during the download process.
cards.name: Intuitive Data Download Interface

cards.desc:
**As a user (who analyses trends), I want to track historical data changes so that I can understand trends and data evolution over time.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- The system provides a mechanism for tracking and viewing historical data.
- Users can access and analyse data changes and trends.
- The historical data is presented in a user-friendly format.
cards.name: Historical Data Management System

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who wants to ensure data integrity), I want to implement a data quality assurance process so that the data used within the platform is accurate and reliable.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- There are automated checks for data accuracy and consistency during import.
- The system alerts data managers to potential data quality issues.
- There is a method for manual data review and correction where necessary.
cards.name: Data Quality Assurance Process

cards.desc:
**As a product manager (who wants to ensure data quality), I want to implement a daily data feed so that the data reflects the credit position and the sales position.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- API feeds are able to operate on a regular basis (ideally weekly)
- Storage system is capable of receiving, storing and manipulating multiple regular data sets
cards.name: Data Upload Frequency

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs to find specific company information),

**I want to** enable advanced search functionality using multiple filters,

**So that** I can refine results and find specific information quickly.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The search function provides multiple filters such as industry, company master data, etc.
- Users can apply multiple filters simultaneously to narrow down search results.
- The search function returns accurate and relevant results promptly.
cards.name: Advanced Company Search Functionality

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs detailed company insights),

**I want to** have the ability to generate customisable company reports,

**So that** I can access tailored financial and operational data as needed.

‌

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can select specific financial and operational data points to include in the report.
- The system allows for configurable report templates (i.e. choose the data you want)
- Generated reports are dynamic, reflecting the most up-to-date data.
cards.name: Dynamic Company Report Generation

cards.desc:
**As a** User (who assesses credit risk),

**I want to** a scoring algorithm,

**So that** I can evaluate a company's likelihood to fulfil payment obligations effectively.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The algorithm uses financial data to calculate a Propensity to Pay score.
- The algorithm's scoring criteria are transparent and understandable.
- The score is displayed within the company's report.

‌

Separate board
cards.name: Propensity to Pay Score Algorithm

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who refines searches frequently),

**I want to** have search results update in real-time as I apply or remove filters,

**So that** I can interactively refine my search and get immediate feedback.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- As filters are applied, the search results update without page refresh.
- The system supports quick toggling of filters to add or remove criteria.
- Results remain relevant and accurate as filters are changed.
cards.name: Real-time Search Results Updating

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who performs complex searches),

**I want to** create and save custom filters,

**So that** I can reuse specific search configurations for frequent searches.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can create custom filters and save them within their profile.
- Users can manage and edit saved filters.
- Saved filters can be applied to new searches with one click.
cards.name: Customisable Filter Creation

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who relies on data to make decisions),

**I want to** have analytics tools integrated into the company reports,

**So that** I can interpret complex data and make informed decisions.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Reports should include embedded analytics tools such as graphs and trend lines.
- Users should be able to manipulate data within the report to analyze different scenarios, (with a focus on timeframe of data conducted
- The integrated tools must provide actionable insights and not just raw data.

(Roadmap)
cards.name: Analytics Integration in Reports

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who values user experience),

**I want to** implement a system for collecting user feedback on reporting tools,

**So that** we can continuously improve and meet user requirements.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A feedback mechanism is integrated into the reporting interface.
- Users can easily provide feedback without leaving the report they are analyzing.
- Feedback is collected, aggregated, and reviewed regularly for possible improvements.
cards.name: User Feedback on Reporting Tools

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs accessible reporting tools),

**I want to** ensure that the reporting tools are accessible and compliant,

**So that** I can use them regardless of any disabilities and know they adhere to legal standards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Reporting tools meet international accessibility standards.
- Tools comply with data privacy and protection laws.
- Users with disabilities find the reporting tools easy and convenient to use.
cards.name: Accessibility and Compliance in Reports

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs to access reports on-the-go),

**I want to** have reports optimised for mobile devices,

**So that** I can view and interact with reports effectively on smaller screens.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Reports are responsive and adapt to various screen sizes and orientations.
- Mobile users can navigate reports without loss of functionality.
- Key report features are easily accessible on a mobile interface.
cards.name: Mobile Optimisation for Reports

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who analyses trends),

**I want to** track historical data changes,

**So that** I can understand trends and data evolution over time.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The system provides a mechanism for tracking and viewing historical data.
- Users can access and analyse data changes and trends.
- The historical data is presented in a user-friendly format.
cards.name: Historical Reporting

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who performs frequent searches),

**I want to** experience a search functionality that adapts to my behaviour,

**So that** I receive more personalised and relevant search results.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The search algorithm learns from my search patterns and preferences.
- I notice an improvement in search result relevance and accuracy over time.
- The platform transparently suggests search improvements and options based on my behavior.
cards.name: Adaptive Search Algorithm Enhancement

cards.desc:
**As a user searching for a company , I would like to be able to search for multiple criteria to find any businesses.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Global Index Data imported and accessible (via Creditsafe TBC)
- Search criteria options include:
  - Name
  - Address
  - VAT
  - CRN
  - Industry
- System is able to retrieve search results including ‘fuzzy searches’ and prioritises results in order of accuracy
- Data fed into the search results is live

Data feed fields examples in attachment.
cards.name: Global Index Data

cards.desc:
**As a user (wants to view client data), I want to see granular supplier data for the specific debtor based on a regular data feed.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Regular data feed should include:
  - No. & value of: disputes, invoices, credits
  - Credit Limit
  - Payment Terms
  - Largest Payment within the last 30 days
  - DSO/DBT
  - 12-month rolling revenue
  - Write-offs/ins (over a threshold)
  - Stop Indicator (account blocks/flags)
  - Debtor information (VAT, CRN, Name, Address)
  - Supplier information (VAT, CRN, Name, Address)
- There should also be a one-off 18 month bulk data import for historical analysis
cards.name: Client Data

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to view credit rating data and financial accounts), I want to see information provided from Credit Rating Agencies, including financial accounts (where applicable), embedded into a scoring facility, with a link to such a report available for further detail.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Ability to download and pay for a full report (including the financials)
- Data Feed Created:
  - Risk Rating
  - Date of last accounts/information
  - Credit Limits recommended
  - Payment Data (D&B)
cards.name: Credit Rating Agencies

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to view insurance data), I want to see detailed insurance information from Marsh, QBE and TokyoMarine.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Data feed established to share:
  - Insured Limit value
  - Insured Limit trend
  - Insured Limit (Yes/No)
  - General overall rating (risk rating)
cards.name: Insurance/Underwriters Data

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to view payment data for a debtor), I want to see payment information provided from debtor suppliers, insurance companies, collection agencies, credit rating agencies and payment check. This way, I can understand how the debtor is performing against other suppliers and on a global perspective.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Experian Payment Performance (Data sample attached containing all fields - see DBT report tab)
- D&B Payment Data & Delinquency Score
- Payment Check Data
- Client/Supplier Data (see Client/Supplier data card for data fields)
- Collections & Legal Data (see Collections & Legal data card for data fields)
- Insurance/Underwriter Data (see Insurance/Underwriter data card for data fields)
cards.name: Payment Data

cards.desc:
**As a user (who wants to view collections performance data), I want to see detailed information on how a debtor is performing with a debt collection agency such as Baker Ing. Such data should be considered in a scorecard, but might not be visible to the user directly (i.e. in the background).**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Data Feed to include:
  - Customer Master Data (VAT, name, address)
  - Identifier of ‘soft collection' approach or debt collection
  - Status of collection (e.g. LBA sent)
  - Value submitted debt collection
  - Age of debt when passed
  - Age of debt from invoice date
  - Collection Rate (TBC as this would depend on the overall performance)
cards.name: Collections & Legal Data

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see a debtor overview selection displaying key ‘master data’ for the debtor being viewed to gain a thorough understanding of the debtor in question.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include:
  - Name
  - Address
  - VAT
  - CRN
  - Industry
  - Legal Structure
  - Owner/Subsidiaries
  - Directors
- Data inputs such as those from client data should populate this section
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: Debtor Overview

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the number of other suppliers trading with a debtor when viewing a debtor report.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include the total number of suppliers
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: Number Of Suppliers

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the average payment term for the debtor so that I can compare this to the expectations of the debtor.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include the average payment term for the customer and all payment terms offered by suppliers
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: Payment Term

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the number of other suppliers trading with a debtor when viewing a debtor report so that I can compare this with the average for the debtor**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information form the underwriters/insurers
- Information included should consider the limits offered, risk rating, trend of the underwriter assessment.
- API data should feed this information into the report live in a list format
cards.name: Underwriter Limits

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the credit limits offered by suppliers when trading with a debtor so that I can compare this with what my company is offering**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information form the suppliers
- Information included should consider the limits offered
- There should be flags for cases whereby no limit has been offered and the customer is blocked
- API data should feed this information into the report live in a list format

- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
cards.name: Supplier Credit Limits

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the credit limits offered by credit rating agencies when trading with a debtor so that I can see an overall rating of the debtor**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information Credit Rating Agencies
- Information included should consider the limits offered, risk ratings/scoring
- Financial Accounts should also be visible within the report
- API data should feed this information into the report live in a list format
cards.name: CRA Recommendations

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the current open debts of a debtor from all suppliers, so that I can see a holistic view and establish whether my level of exposure is significant compared to others.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from suppliers
- Information included should consider the limits offered
- Visual aid such as a graph should be included
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live in a list format
cards.name: Open Debt Value

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the performance of the debtor with collections agencies, so that I can see the amount with collections, the status of any legal involvement, and the general responsiveness/performance.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from Baker Ing
- Information included should consider:
  - Amount with collections
  - Payment recevied
  - Status (e.g. collections, legal letter sent, etc.)
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live and may be displayed in a list or graphic.
cards.name: Collections Data

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see sales/turnover for a debtor per supplier, so that I can compare the level of activity of a debtor with various suppliers.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from suppliers
- Information included should consider an annual period of turnover and be able to include a previous period too.
- Visual aid such as a graph should be included
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: Debtor turnover per supplier

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the amount of write-offs and write-ins for a debtor, so that I can see how much is written off/in throughout an annual period to compare the debtors performance for my company to others.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from suppliers
- Information included should consider the write-offs and write-ins
- Visual aid such as a graph should be included
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: Annual Write-off/-in

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the payment performance in the form of Days Sales Outstanding (DSO) and Days Beyond Terms (DBT) for a debtor, so that I can see debtor performance for my company against other suppliers.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include information from suppliers
- Information included should consider the DSO & DBT
- Visual aid such as a graph should be included
- Filter criteria must adjust this field for cases to show total suppliers within ‘my sector’ and ‘globally’.
- API data should feed this information into the report live
cards.name: DSO/DBT

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see the latest news alerts of a debtor, so that I can make executive decisions about action to be taken.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include an area for ‘a latest news’
- AI intelligence utilised to target specific cases (e.g. for the words ‘john + lewis + sale’, I want to know if John Lewis is for sale, but I am less interested if John Lewis is having a sale)
- Alerts should be sent via email to notify a user of debtors they are trading with if there have been any developments.
cards.name: Google Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a user looking at a debtor report, I would like to see general comments/updates from suppliers of such a debtor, so that, I can provide updates myself and also see information that can not be quantified within the report.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Segment of the report must include commentary information from suppliers
- Creation of a list of most recent comments
- Option to add/edit/delete comments which are added to a debtors report page
- Access to provide comments should be for all users
- Comments should prompt alerts
cards.name: Supplier Comments

cards.desc:
**As a user who analyses credit risk, I want to be able to see an overall score established on a scoring algorithm and scorecard so that I can see determine the likelihood of payment default when trading with the customer.**

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A ‘Propensity To Pay score’ established based on an algorithm, thresholds and weighted averages from the data found within a debtor report and the relevant background data.
- The algorithm's scoring criteria are transparent and understandable.
- The score is displayed within the debtor’s report.
- A recommendation is provided with such a score
cards.name: Propensity To Pay Score

cards.desc:
**As a user who analyses credit risk, I want to be able to see a scorecard to understand the key performance indicators of a debtor, so that I can interpret an overall score and identify the main areas of concern when it comes to default risk.**

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A ‘scorecard’ established based on an algorithm, thresholds and weighted averages from the data found within a debtor report and the relevant background data
- The score is displayed within the debtor’s report alongside the ‘propensity to pay’ score
- The Scorecard should be multi-sector and not tailored per sector/industry
  (reason: a debtor might by multi-sector and be involved in apparel retail and manufacturing)
- The algorithm's scoring criteria are transparent and understandable.
- Scorecard criteria to be determined at a later date subject to what data we can obtain.
cards.name: Scorecard

cards.desc:
**As a user who often looks at debtor reports, I would like to make sure that I can monitor certain debtors, so that I can make quick timely decisions surrounding the latest information feeds.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Monitoring facility to be embedded into a debtor profile which may be opted in/out of by a supplier.
- Monitoring Maintenance page created for user to adjust which debtors are being monitored
- Alerts and notifications sent via email to users monitoring a debtor
- Monitoring includes any AI feeds relative to news updates or companies for which a supplier has written a comment
cards.name: User Maintenance

cards.desc:
**As a user wanting to keep up to date with debtors, I want to learn whenever new information is available, so that I can make any necessary credit risk changes to trade.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Monitoring includes any AI feeds relative to news updates or companies for which a supplier has written a comment
- Alerts and notifications sent via email to users monitoring a debtor
- Email alerts should provide a snapshot of the ‘update’ and a link to view the main changes
- Any main changes should be accessible via a link, and result in payment for extra information (e.g. updated financials)
cards.name: Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a user receiving monitoring alerts, I want to be able to see such alerts in a debtor report so that I can view all information in one location.**

Acceptance Criteria:

- Debtor report created and inclusive of the latest monitoring alerts
- Monitoring alerts visible within an exported PDF
- Latest alerts visible with option to see historically
cards.name: Debtor Report

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who values efficiency),

**I want to** navigate the platform intuitively,

**So that** I can find the information I need quickly and effortlessly.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Navigation menus are clear and self-explanatory.
- Key features are easily accessible from any page.
- Users report high satisfaction with navigation in user experience surveys.
cards.name: Intuitive Navigation Design

cards.desc:
**As a** non-English speaking user,

**I want to** access the platform in my native language,

**So that** I can understand and use the platform without language barriers.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform supports multiple languages.
- Language settings are easy to find and change.
- Content translations are accurate and culturally appropriate.
cards.name: Multi-language Content Support

cards.desc:
**As a** mobile user,

**I want to** have a seamless experience on my device,

**So that** I can use the platform on the go without any issues.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform is fully responsive and functions well on a range of mobile devices.
- Interactive elements are touch-friendly and easy to use on small screens.
- Users can complete all necessary tasks on mobile without needing a desktop.
cards.name: Mobile Responsiveness

cards.desc:
**As a** user with accessibility needs,

**I want to** use a platform that complies with accessibility standards,

**So that** I can navigate and interact with the platform independently.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform meets WCAG 2.1 standards at a minimum.
- Accessibility features such as screen reader support and keyboard navigation are implemented.
- Users with disabilities can use the platform without barriers.
cards.name: Accessibility Compliance

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who appreciates a coherent experience),

**I want to** see consistency in the user interface,

**So that** I can predictably interact with the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Design elements like colors, fonts, and layouts are consistent across the platform.
- Users can intuitively understand the interface without re-learning for different sections.
- Consistent UI leads to a decrease in user-reported confusion or errors.
cards.name: User Interface Consistency

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who wants an improved experience),

**I want to** provide feedback on the UI/UX,

**So that** the platform can evolve to better meet my needs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- A clear mechanism for submitting UI/UX feedback is available.
- Feedback is reviewed and acted upon in a timely manner.
- Changes based on feedback are communicated back to the users.
cards.name: User Feedback Loop for UI/UX

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who dislikes waiting),

**I want to** interact with a high-performance UI,

**So that** I can complete tasks quickly and efficiently.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Pages load quickly, even with slow internet connections.
- Performance metrics are monitored, with ongoing improvements.
- User satisfaction with performance is reflected in feedback.
cards.name: UI Performance Optimisation

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who enjoys engaging experiences),

**I want to** see interactive elements and micro-interactions,

**So that** I feel more connected and engaged with the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Interactive elements enhance the user experience without overwhelming.
- Micro-interactions provide meaningful feedback in response to user actions.
- User engagement metrics improve after the introduction of these elements.
cards.name: Interactive Elements & Micro-interactions

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who uses different browsers),

**I want to** access the platform across various browsers,

**So that** I can have a consistent experience no matter what browser I use.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform is tested and functional across major browsers.
- Browser-specific bugs are identified and resolved promptly.
- Users report a consistent experience across different browsers.
cards.name: Cross-Browser Compatibility

cards.desc:
**As a** user

**I want to** view and manage my subscription plans easily,

**So that** I can understand and control my service usage and costs.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Subscription details are clearly displayed.
- Users can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel subscriptions.
- The platform confirms changes to subscriptions with the user.
cards.name: Subscription Plan Display and Management

cards.desc:
**As a** user,

**I want to** have my invoices generated automatically,

**So that** I can manage my financial records without manual intervention.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Invoices reflect accurate charges and are generated on schedule.
- Users receive notifications when new invoices are available.
- The system archives invoices for future reference.
cards.name: Invoice Generation System

cards.desc:
**As a** user needing financial documentation,

**I want to** download my invoices,

**So that** I can keep my financial records up to date and backed up.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can download invoices in PDF or other convenient formats.
- Downloaded invoices match the original format and data.
- The download process is intuitive and reliable.
cards.name: Invoice Download Functionality

cards.desc:
**As a** user,

**I want to** monitor my account usage,

**So that** I can optimize my subscription plan based on actual usage.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform provides detailed reports on account usage.
- Users can access usage statistics in real-time.
- The system alerts users as they approach their plan limits.
cards.name: Account Usage Monitoring

cards.desc:
**As a** user who values responsible spending,

**I want to** track my budget in relation to subscription costs,

**So that** I can plan my finances and avoid overspending.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can set budget limits and monitor them against subscription costs.
- The system provides visual aids like charts to track budget usage.
- Alerts notify users when they are nearing their budget limit.
cards.name: Budget Tracking Integration

cards.desc:
**As a** user who manages multiple subscriptions,

**I want to** receive automated payment reminders,

**So that** I can ensure timely payments and uninterrupted service.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users receive reminders before each payment due date.
- Reminders include payment amount and due date.
- Users can customize the timing and method of reminders.
cards.name: Automated Payment Reminders

cards.desc:
**As a** user with billing questions,

**I want to** use a self-service portal,

**So that** I can resolve my queries quickly without needing to contact support.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The self-service portal includes FAQs and troubleshooting guides.
- Users can submit and track the status of billing queries.
- The system offers guidance for common billing issues.
cards.name: Self-Service Billing Queries

cards.desc:
**As an** user operating in a different currency,

**I want to** conduct transactions in my local currency and understand tax implications,

**So that** I can manage my subscription without currency or tax confusion.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The system supports multiple currencies and accurately converts prices.
- Tax calculations are in accordance with local tax laws.
- Users can see a breakdown of charges, including taxes, before payment.
cards.name: Currency and Tax Handling System

cards.desc:
To be reviewed looking in tandem with live data from CRA’s who need to provide financial details instantly into the scorecard.

Pricing is subject to the above.

Look into how the billing and payment is conducted, enterprise tiers, monthly/quarterly, POs in place with terms, unit purchase.

Phone and ask around to see what other users are doing? Use Commercial Outcomes (ask Warren).

‌

Ask Lisa if we can resell credit data. We will technically be selling this

Do we need to be FCA certified? Understanding is ‘no’, but the source needs to be FCA certified

But if we are adding in our opinion, then we are selling a credit opinion … potential hurdle to be investigated.

‌

Pricing Matrix per country
cards.name: Hmmmm?

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who manages diverse industry needs),

**I want to** configure subsidiary settings for sector-specific customisation,

**So that** the platform can cater to the unique requirements of each industry.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform supports configuration for various industries.
- Administrators can easily customize settings for each subsidiary.
- The customisations address the specific needs of each sector effectively.
cards.name: Subsidiary Configuration for Sector Customisation

cards.desc:
**As a** user in a specific industry,

**I want to** have dynamic report generation capabilities,

**So that** I can create reports that are tailored to my industry’s unique requirements.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can generate reports with industry-specific data and metrics.
- The report generation tool is flexible and adaptable to various industries.
- Reports are insightful and meet the analytical needs of users in each industry.
cards.name: Dynamic Report Generation for Industries

cards.desc:
**As a** user in a specialised industry,

**I want to** use tools that adapt analytics and visualisations to my industry,

**So that** I can gain insights relevant to my specific field.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Analytics and visualisation tools are customisable for different industries.
- Tools are capable of handling industry-specific data formats and metrics.
- Visualisations are meaningful and provide actionable insights for users.
cards.name: Customisable Analytics and Visualisation Tools

cards.desc:
**As a** user conducting industry-specific research,

**I want to** use enhanced filtering options,

**So that** I can efficiently find information relevant to my sector.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Advanced filtering options are available for sector-specific searches (i.e. your sector vs all).
- Filters are intuitive and cater to the unique aspects of each industry.
- Search results are relevant and accurately reflect the applied filters.
cards.name: Enhanced Filtering for Sector-Specific Search

cards.desc:
**As a** user in a sensitive industry,

**I want to** have customisable access controls,

**So that** I can manage who accesses industry-specific data and features.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Access controls can be tailored to suit industry-specific roles.
- The platform ensures data sensitivity is maintained in access permissions.
- Administrators can easily manage and modify access controls as needed.
cards.name: Industry-Specific Access Controls

cards.desc:
**As a** user in a particular industry,

**I want to** have a personalised dashboard,

**So that** I can view relevant industry-specific data and metrics at a glance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Dashboards can be customised to display industry-specific information.
- Users can personalise their dashboard to suit their individual needs.
- The dashboard provides a concise overview of relevant data and insights.
cards.name: Sector-Based Dashboard Customisation

cards.desc:
**As a** user needing to share industry-specific data,

**I want to** export data in formats suitable for my industry,

**So that** I can easily share and utilise data according to industry standards.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Data can be exported in various formats that cater to different industries.
- The export process is straightforward and maintains data integrity.
- Exported data is compatible with common industry-specific tools.
cards.name: Customisation of Data Export

cards.desc:
**As a** user who needs to stay informed about industry trends,

**I want to** receive industry-specific alerts,

**So that** I’m promptly notified about important updates or anomalies.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The system sends alerts for industry-specific data updates or unusual activities.
- Users can customize the type and frequency of alerts they receive.
- Alerts are timely and provide relevant information for quick decision-makin
cards.name: Integration of Industry-Specific Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a** user in a regulated industry,

**I want to** ensure that customisations comply with industry regulations,

**So that** my use of the platform adheres to legal standards and best practices.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Customisations consider and comply with relevant industry regulations.
- The platform provides guidance or warnings about compliance issues.
- Regular updates are made to ensure ongoing adherence to regulations.
cards.name: Compliance and Regulation Adherence

cards.desc:
**As a user seeking payment information, I would like to see how a debtor is paying myself, and those within my sector as well as globally (across several sectors), so that I can see a holistic view and comparison in the scoring models and visuals.**

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Filter criteria available within any debtor reports that display information specific to initial supplier, sector as a whole, and then globally for that debtor (i.e. every sector).
- Drop-down options for the above provided for the user to select
- Regular updates are made to ensure ongoing adherence to regulations.
cards.name: Add in

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who reviews reports),

**I want to** leave comments and feedback directly on reports,

**So that** I can provide input or highlight areas of interest or concern.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can easily leave comments on specific sections of a report.
- Feedback is saved and can be viewed by authorized personnel.
- The system notifies relevant team members when new feedback is added.
- Commenters should be verified but not identifiable (Blockpass)
- Emails/Alerts should be triggered when comments are made
cards.name: Report Feedback System

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who frequently exports data),

**I want to** customize data exports based on my preferences and needs,

**So that** I can work with data in the format most useful to me.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can choose from various data export formats and settings.
- The system remembers user preferences for future exports.
- Export customization options are flexible and user-friendly.
cards.name: Custom Data Export Preferences

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who monitors specific metrics),

**I want to** create and personalize my dashboard,

**So that** I can quickly view data and insights that are pertinent to me.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Dashboards are fully customizable with drag-and-drop functionality.
- Users can save multiple dashboard configurations.
- Personalized dashboards accurately display selected data and metrics.
cards.name: Personalised Dashboard Configuration

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs to annotate data),

**I want to** add comments on specific data points within reports and dashboards,

**So that** I can provide context or flag data for review.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Commenting functionality is available on data points in reports and dashboards.
- Comments are visible to other users with access to the same data.
- The system allows for easy management and review of comments.
cards.name: User Commenting on Data Points

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who seeks user input),

**I want to** aggregate user feedback for analysis,

**So that** we can make informed decisions to improve the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform collects and aggregates feedback from various channels.
- Analytical tools are available to interpret and visualize user feedback.
- Insights from feedback analysis guide platform updates and improvements.
cards.name: Feedback Aggregation and Analysis Tools

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who seeks data-driven insights),

**I want to** receive recommendations based on my dashboard activity,

**So that** I can discover new insights and optimise my workflow.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The system analyses user interaction with the dashboard.
- Users receive personalized insights and data-driven recommendations.
- Recommendations are relevant, actionable, and based on user preferences.
cards.name: Dashboard Insights and Recommendations

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs specific data formats),

**I want to** use a wizard tool for customising export formats,

**So that** I can easily choose the exact content and format I need.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The wizard guides users through customising the format and content of exports.
- Users can preview and adjust export settings before finalizing.
- The tool is intuitive and accommodates a range of custom export requirements.
cards.name: Export Format Customisation Wizard

cards.desc:
**As a** new user (who wants to fully utilise the platform),

**I want to** access training and resources,

**So that** I can effectively use the platform's interaction and feedback features.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Comprehensive training materials are available within the platform.
- Resources are easy to understand and cater to users with varying skill levels.
- Users report increased proficiency and satisfaction after using the resources.
cards.name: User Interaction Training and Resources

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who aims to enhance engagement),

**I want to** integrate analytics to measure user engagement,

**So that** we can understand and improve user interactions within the platform.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Analytics tools track user engagement metrics like session duration, feature usage, etc.
- The platform provides visualisations and reports on engagement analytics.
- Insights from engagement analytics are used to inform UI/UX improvements.
cards.name: User Engagement Analytics Integration

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs to stay informed about market changes),

**I want to** integrate external news and alerts services into the platform,

**So that** I can receive the latest updates on companies within my portfolio.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform seamlessly integrates with key news and alert services.
- Users receive timely updates relevant to their interests and portfolio.
- News feeds and alerts are customisable according to user preferences.
- Alerts sent on companies which are being monitored
- Heading and link to report with charge subject to type of change

Endole (search for company)
cards.name: Integration with News and Alerts Services

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who relies on timely data),

**I want to** receive tailored notifications when reports I'm interested in are updated,

**So that** I can promptly access the latest information.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can subscribe to notifications for specific reports.
- Notifications alert users of new updates or report generations.
- The notification system is reliable and provides timely updates.
cards.name: Personalised Report Update Notifications

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who manages large datasets),

**I want to** be notified in real-time about significant data changes and synchronisation status,

**So that** I can ensure my data is current and accurate.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Alerts notify users of important data changes and sync statuses.
- Real-time notifications keep users informed of the latest data updates.
- The alert system is reliable and reflects accurate data status.
cards.name: Data Change and Sync Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs specific information),

**I want to** customise alert configurations,

**So that** I can receive notifications that are most relevant to my work.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can set detailed preferences for the types of alerts they receive.
- The customisation options are flexible and cover a wide range of alert types.
- Users can easily modify their alert settings as their needs change.
cards.name: Customisable Alert Configurations

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who receives various alerts),

**I want to** have a dedicated area to manage all my alerts,

**So that** I can have an overview and make easy adjustments.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform provides a centralised location for managing alerts.
- Users can view, customise, and manage all their alerts easily.
- The management area is intuitive and user-friendly.
cards.name: Alert Management and Overview

cards.desc:
**As a** user who values compliance,

**I want to** be notified of important regulatory changes,

**So that** I can ensure compliance in data handling and reporting.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Alerts are sent to users regarding relevant regulatory changes.
- Notifications include details on how the changes affect platform use.
- Users can access further information or guidance on compliance issues.
cards.name: Regulatory Compliance Alerts

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who needs to monitor specific metrics),

**I want to** set custom thresholds for receiving alerts,

**So that** I am notified when certain criteria are met or exceeded.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can define thresholds for various metrics that trigger alerts.
- The system accurately detects when thresholds are met and sends alerts.
- Threshold settings are flexible and can be adjusted by the user at any time.
cards.name: Alert Threshold Configuration

cards.desc: Have a look but should all be aligned.
cards.name: All of the above can be put in the top one

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who may need assistance),

**I want to** have a comprehensive 'Contact Us' system,

**So that** I can easily get in touch with Global IQ support for help.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The 'Contact Us' system is easily accessible from any part of the platform.
- Users can contact support through various methods like email, phone, or chat.
- The system provides clear instructions and immediate confirmation of contact.
cards.name: Comprehensive 'Contact Us' System

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who prefers different communication methods),

**I want to** have multiple direct communication channels available,

**So that** I can choose my preferred method to seek assistance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Various communication channels like live chat, email, and phone support are available.
- Users can easily find and access these communication options.
- The platform guides users to the most appropriate channel for their query.
cards.name: Direct Communication Channels

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who encounters platform issues),

**I want to** use a ticketing system,

**So that** I can report issues and track their resolution.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can easily submit support tickets directly through the platform.
- Each ticket includes a tracking number and status updates.
- Users receive notifications about changes or resolutions to their tickets.
cards.name: User Support Ticketing System

cards.desc: Implement a ticketing system for users to report issues and track their resolution progress.
cards.name: User Support Ticketing System

cards.desc:
**As a** user needing immediate help,

**I want to** receive real-time support,

**So that** I can resolve issues promptly with direct assistance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Real-time support options like chat or phone calls are available.
- Support staff can provide immediate troubleshooting and guidance.
- The system offers an option for escalated support if needed.
cards.name: Real-time Support and Troubleshooting

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who values good service),

**I want to** provide feedback on my support experience,

**So that** the service can be continuously improved.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- After a support interaction, users are invited to provide feedback.
- The feedback process is quick, easy, and optional.
- Collected feedback is analyzed to improve customer support services.
cards.name: Feedback Mechanism for Support

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who wants to be well-informed),

**I want to** receive proactive communication from the platform,

**So that** I’m aware of important updates, changes, or maintenance.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users are notified about significant platform updates or changes in advance.
- The platform provides clear, concise, and timely communication.
- Communication channels include email, in-platform notifications, or others as appropriate.
cards.name: Proactive Customer Communication

cards.desc:
**As a** user seeking information,

**I want to** access a comprehensive knowledge base,

**So that** I can find answers to my questions and learn how to use the platform effectively.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The knowledge base covers a wide range of topics, including FAQs, tutorials, and troubleshooting guides.
- Content is easy to search, well-organised, and up-to-date.
- Users report finding the information they need quickly and efficiently.
cards.name: Knowledge Base Development

cards.desc:
**As a** user (concerned about data privacy),

**I want to** be assured that robust data privacy measures are implemented,

**So that** my information is protected in accordance with global standards and regulations.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform complies with international data privacy laws like GDPR.
- Users are informed about how their data is used and protected.
- Regular audits are conducted to ensure ongoing compliance with data privacy standards.
cards.name: Data Privacy Assurance

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who values cybersecurity),

**I want to** use a platform with a secure infrastructure,

**So that** I am safeguarded against unauthorized access, data breaches, and cyber threats.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform employs state-of-the-art security measures.
- Security features include firewalls, encryption, and intrusion detection systems.
- Regular security assessments are conducted to identify and mitigate potential threats.
cards.name: Security Infrastructure Development

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who wants control over my personal data),

**I want to** have clear control and management of my data within the platform,

**So that** my privacy is maintained and my data is used only as I permit.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- Users can easily access and control their personal data settings.
- The platform provides clear options for data sharing and privacy preferences.
- Access to sensitive data is strictly managed and logged.
cards.name: User Data Control and Access Management

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (responsible for legal compliance),

**I want to** monitor and ensure compliance with trade, commerce, and financial regulations,

**So that** the platform operates within legal boundaries.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The platform has mechanisms to continuously monitor compliance with relevant regulations.
- Compliance reports are generated and reviewed regularly.
- Updates to regulations are tracked and implemented promptly in the platform.
cards.name: Regulatory Compliance Monitoring

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who oversees data lifecycle),

**I want to** establish a data retention and disposal policy,

**So that** stored data is managed legally and efficiently throughout its lifecycle.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The policy outlines clear guidelines for data retention and disposal.
- Data retention schedules comply with legal requirements.
- Secure and environmentally friendly methods are used for data disposal.
cards.name: Data Retention and Disposal Policy

cards.desc:
**As a** user (who wants to contribute to security),

**I want to** participate in a user awareness and training program,

**So that** I can understand data protection practices and my role in maintaining security.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The program covers topics like data protection and safe platform usage.
- Training materials are accessible, engaging, and easy to understand.
- Users are tested on their knowledge and receive certification upon completion.
cards.name: User Awareness and Training Program

cards.desc:
**As a** product manager (who needs to track compliance),

**I want to** implement a system to log and track compliance-related actions,

**So that** we have a clear audit trail for regulatory purposes.

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- The system logs all actions related to compliance.
- Audit trails are easily accessible and securely stored.
- The system supports reporting and analysis of compliance activities.
cards.name: Compliance Audit Trail System
